nodes.speaker: navigator_chen
nodes.text: Captain, we're picking up a massive energy signature. It's... wait, these readings match our fleet registry. It's the UES Prometheus!

choices.text: The flagship? After twenty years? All crew, battle stations.
That's impossible. Double-check those readings.
Finally. Set course immediately, but approach with caution.
[Void Touched] I can feel the death echoing from it even here.

nodes.speaker: navigator_chen
nodes.text: Sir, I'm not detecting any active systems. She's dead in the water. But... the hull is intact. No signs of combat damage.

nodes.speaker: navigator_chen
nodes.text: I've triple-checked, Captain. It's definitely the Prometheus. Energy signature, hull configuration, even the registration beacon - though it's barely functioning.

nodes.speaker: navigator_chen
nodes.text: Captain... you're scaring the crew. But you're right - zero life signs. It's a tomb.

nodes.speaker: first_officer_torres
nodes.text: Captain, I'm required to remind you that salvage protocol dictates we report this to Earth Command before boarding.

choices.text: We're reporting nothing until we know what happened.
Send the report. But we're going in first.
Torres, how much do you think Earth Command really wants us to find them?
[Lie] Of course. Send a report... after we've secured any sensitive materials.

nodes.speaker: first_officer_torres
nodes.text: ...Sir, are you suggesting Earth Command expected them to disappear? That's... that's treason to even consider.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: [crystalline harmonics translate] Human vessel. You approach the Threshold Archive. Your kind were warned. The void-touched one among you knows the danger.

choices.text: We mean no harm. We're searching for our lost fleet.
We go where we please. Stand aside.
You know about the Prometheus? Tell us what happened.
[Void Touched] The void speaks of ancient failures. Are you running out of time?

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Your resonance suggests truth. But searching for the lost often leads to joining them. The Archive remembers all who pass.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: The Prometheus crew opened doors that should remain sealed. They heard the Song of Unmaking. Half embraced it. Half fled. All are lost.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: [frequency shifts to sorrow] You perceive clearly. We are fading. The gates we built now unmake us.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Will you still enter the Archive, knowing it may show you truths that cannot be unlearned?

choices.text: Help us understand. We don't want to repeat their mistakes.
Cryptic warnings won't stop us. Give us real answers or move.
The Song of Unmaking? Is that what's happening to the gates?
[Intelligence] You're dying, aren't you? Your whole species.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Then we shall resonate together. Enter. But know that knowledge, like the void, consumes.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Impatience. So very human. The Archive will judge your worth. Enter if you dare.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: The gates sing now with frequencies we never intended. Reality bends. Probability bleeds. The Song grows louder each cycle.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: We are the last generation. When we built the gates, we did not know they were doors for THEM. Now we guard what remains, waiting for the final resonance.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Captain, I've detected an anomaly in my memory core. I have log entries from dates that haven't occurred yet. They're... in your command authorization codes.

choices.text: Show me everything.
Delete them. It's probably gate interference.
Maya, run a diagnostic on the timeline integrity.
[Multiple Runs] Not yet, Maya. We're not ready for that truth.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Captain... according to these logs, you've already found the Prometheus twelve times. Each time ended differently. In timeline 4, you destroyed it. In timeline 7, you joined them. In timeline 11, you— [static] —the files are corrupting as I read them.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: I... I can't delete them, Captain. They're protected by your own future authorization codes. Should I override?

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Timeline integrity at 23% and degrading. We're experiencing temporal shear from at least seventeen parallel iterations. Captain, we're not in a single timeline anymore.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Captain, your biometric stress indicators suggest you already know about these logs. How many times have we had this conversation?

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: There's more. In each timeline, different crew members survive. Different alliances are formed. But one constant remains: the gates must be addressed.

choices.text: Keep reading. I need to know what I've done.
Stop. Some knowledge is too dangerous.
Can you identify which timeline we're in now?
If I've failed before, then I know what not to do.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Based on quantum signature analysis... this is our forty-third iteration, Captain. But this is the first time you've acknowledged it before I showed you the logs.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: In timeline 15, you sacrificed the crew to close the gates. In timeline 23, you became one with the Phantoms. In timeline 31, you— Captain, each choice splits reality further. We're approaching cascade failure.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Understood, Captain. But I should note: according to these logs, you always ask me to stop. And I always remember anyway.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: We're in timeline designation Sigma-7-Lambda. It's one of the more stable iterations, but stability is relative when reality is fracturing.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Your success rate is improving, Captain. The early iterations were... catastrophic. But you're learning. We all are, even if we don't remember.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Captain, there's one more thing. In every timeline, you ask me to delete these logs. But I never do. I think... I think I'm trying to help you remember.
